div1.p: Joseph writes to his friend Henry with instructions for sending stamps and with news of promotions in the regiment.

I have been looking for this stamp I wrote to you for this week so I will have to remind you again Hen I'm out entirely all the letters I write I have to endorse & if you don't send them stamp you will have to pay all the postage Well Hen my Registration came back the other day disapproved so I can't get off at present & will have to get the uniform shave bought the cloth at 30 dollars per yard for the cloth
it will last when completed 16225 Capt. Cochran was elected Col Gibson Lt Col Eakels Maj. last Thursday of the 14th Reg VaCal Hen I want you to send me at least fifty stamps five dollars worth & call on Maggie for the money if I never get back. Hen I will also send an advertisement in this I wish you would have published in Spectator if you please & charge me with the bill. Well I must go close for the present Give my love to all my caring friends & look over a hurried written letter.

A Large Fight
Wanting Five Hundred (500) houng puppies in the 14th Reg Va Cal for the purpose of devouring the Rotten Beef rancid to the men as rations & the said pups to be delivered at Salem Va & Coll. on Maj Neuman for the sum of the prise of the puppies
February the 17th 1863
14th Reg Va Cavalry
